The problem persists even after logout/login.

Marcelo Petrucelli

fields.description:
I believe this changed recently, i.e., today: the list of commits in the JSON sent by the POST service is backwards with the oldest commit first, and the newest commit last.

I setup [a test repository|https://bitbucket.org/mg/post-test/] to verify this and posted to a [postbin service|http://requestb.in/vdc8nnvd%3Finspect]. The JSON posted looks like this:

{code}
>>> pprint(json.loads(payload))
{u'canon_url': u'https://bitbucket.org',
 u'commits': [{u'author': u'mg',
               u'branch': u'default',
               u'files': [{u'file': u'a.txt', u'type': u'modified'}],
               u'message': u'second',
               u'node': u'bb432135bdb5',
               u'parents': [u'34fb7a4e134a'],
               u'raw_author': u'Martin Geisler <martin.geisler@dealini.ch>',
               u'raw_node': u'bb432135bdb590104d01c108ea6e4d26c90b3dd9',
               u'revision': 1,
               u'size': -1,
               u'timestamp': u'2013-04-19 17:43:23',
               u'utctimestamp': u'2013-04-19 15:43:23+00:00'},
              {u'author': u'mg',
               u'branch': u'default',
               u'files': [{u'file': u'a.txt', u'type': u'added'}],
               u'message': u'first',
               u'node': u'34fb7a4e134a',
               u'parents': [],
               u'raw_author': u'Martin Geisler <martin.geisler@dealini.ch>',
               u'raw_node': u'34fb7a4e134a49ede8516c798b1ba807980d9ced',
               u'revision': 0,
               u'size': -1,
               u'timestamp': u'2013-04-19 17:43:17',
               u'utctimestamp': u'2013-04-19 15:43:17+00:00'}],
 u'repository': {u'absolute_url': u'/mg/post-test/',
                 u'fork': False,
                 u'is_private': False,
                 u'name': u'post-test',
                 u'owner': u'mg',
                 u'scm': u'hg',
                 u'slug': u'post-test',
                 u'website': u''},
 u'truncated': False,
 u'user': u'mg'}
{code}

This confuses my [Buildbot|http://buildbot.net/]: it sees the changes and thinks the last commit (really the first) is the one it should build. It builds this commit and fails to build the following commits.
fields.summary: POST service orders commits backwards (BB-8235)

fields.description:
Earlier today:

* I renamed croquetscores.com repository to WasMercurial.croquetscores.com.
* Locally created a Git repository from the mercurial repository.
* Created croquetscores.com as a Git repository on your site.
* Pushed my local repository to croquetscores.com.

I've done several commit, pull and push requests and everything seems fine on that front.

The problem I'm having is with my application on AppHarbor, it is not building the application after a push. I have contacted AppHarbor and they have asked me to contact you. They have confirmed my setup is correct but they are not receiving the push notifications, hence the reason for this support issue.

I have tried the following to resolve the issue:

* Removed and added apphb to Access management.
* Removed and added AppHarbor under services.

I followed the instructions on http://support.appharbor.com/kb/3rd-party-integrations/integrating-with-bitbucket to setup AppHarbor and BitBucket.

Thanks in advance\\
Tim
fields.summary: Push notifications are not being received by AppHarbor

fields.description:
I added a custom field to  be able to sort notes by information category (i.e. pre-sales, transaction, customer complaint, feedback, etc.) and can write custom SQL queries to report on them, but I imagine many would benefit from adding an additional configurable sorting category to notes and tasks.

Customer service people need to quickly sort through a lot of unstructured information when serving a customer and these fields are often used to capture the interaction history of a customer.  An ability to filter them by a configurable information category would greatly improve the usability of this system.

It would also help to personalize the location of these portlets (as in the contact view) as not everyone values each portlet's utility the same.

Inspired by your work...
fields.summary: Need ability to further categorize notes and tasks

fields.description:
For example:

UserA has a repository (Repo1) they'd like to transfer to UserB. Prior to this point, UserB had explicit permission to this repository at http://bitbucket.org/usera/repo1/admin/access. When the repository transfer takes place from UserA -> UserB, the permission will remain. This effectively means that UserB is now both an owner, and has explicit permission to the repo. This also will cause UserB to have 1 less available user in their account.

The UI of the repo access page also won't show this, but the Manage Account screen for UserB will. https://bitbucket.org/account/user/userb/plans-and-billing/ would show that userb also has "Direct access" to repositories twice in that list.
fields.summary: Transferring a repository to a user when that user already has explicit permissions to the repo will result in issues (BB-8230)

fields.description:
Replacing newlines with {{System.Environment.Newline}} changes the document's existing line endings. For example, the Regex:

{{@"[ \t]+\r?\n"}}

To fix, simply replace this regex with {{@"[ \t]+$"}} and change the replace string to {{string.Emtpy}}. You could also change the regex to {{@"[ \t]+(?=\r?\n)"}}, which uses a look-ahead, but I believe the former is a much better solution.

In other places, you might need to use a back-reference to not change the existing line endings.

You might be interested in why I would use anything other than {{System.Environment.Newline}}. Well, I'm using the EditorConfig extension to keep my newlines consistent w/ the team project, but CodeMaid keeps changing my newlines, making them inconsistent. It took me a while to figure out what was doing it.
fields.summary: RemoveWhitespaceLogic Changes Existing Newlines

fields.description:
hi,\\
a few days ago I started to use Bitbucket.org; my bitbucket account is "nimblebit".

So I have tried to use Bitbucket.org as repository SCM and as remote repository to hold custom Maven artifacts and dependencies.

I noticed a bug ... I have created a repository PRIVATE "m2_repo" and filled with a test library dependency "test-api" and I run my pom.xml (_see below_).

**\\
I am able to download the contents of my private repository without authentication ... also my colleague, who NOT has an account on bitbucket, he is also able to download the contents of my private repository without authentication!!\\
**

Below pom.xml I use!

{code}
#!xml

<project xmlns="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0" xmlns:xsi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance"
  xsi:schemaLocation="http://maven.apache.org/POM/4.0.0 http://maven.apache.org/maven-v4_0_0.xsd">
  <modelVersion>4.0.0</modelVersion>

  <groupId>it.fastbookspa.test</groupId>
  <artifactId>test-app</artifactId>
  <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
  <packaging>war</packaging>

  <name>test-app Maven Webapp</name>
  <url>http://maven.apache.org</url>

  <properties>
	<project.build.sourceEncoding>UTF-8</project.build.sourceEncoding>
        <!--
        SAME PROBLEM: ANONYMOUS ACCESS
        <m2_repo.path>https://bitbucket.org/nimblebit/m2_repo/raw/master</m2_repo.path>
        -->

	<m2_repo.path>https://bitbucket.org/nimblebit/m2_repo/raw</m2_repo.path>
  </properties>

  <dependencies>
    <dependency>
      <groupId>junit</groupId>
      <artifactId>junit</artifactId>
      <version>3.8.1</version>
      <scope>test</scope>
    </dependency>

   <dependency>
      <groupId>it.fastbookspa.test</groupId>
      <artifactId>test-api</artifactId>
      <version>1.0-SNAPSHOT</version>
    </dependency>
 </dependencies>

<repositories>
	<repository>
		<id>m2_repo_snapshots</id>
		<name>m2_repo snapshots</name>
		<url>${m2_repo.path}/snapshots</url>
		<releases>
			<enabled>false</enabled>
			<updatePolicy>always</updatePolicy>
			<!--
			<checksumPolicy>warn</checksumPolicy>
			-->
		</releases>
		<snapshots>
			<enabled>true</enabled>
			<updatePolicy>never</updatePolicy>
			<!--
			<checksumPolicy>fail</checksumPolicy>
			-->
		</snapshots>
		<layout>default</layout>
	</repository>
	<repository>
		<id>m2_repo_releases</id>
		<name>m2_repo releases</name>
		<url>${m2_repo.path}/releases</url>
		<releases>
			<enabled>true</enabled>
			<updatePolicy>always</updatePolicy>
			<!--
			<checksumPolicy>fail</checksumPolicy>
			-->
		</releases>
		<snapshots>
			<enabled>false</enabled>
			<updatePolicy>always</updatePolicy>
			<!--
			<checksumPolicy>warn</checksumPolicy>
			-->
		</snapshots>
		<layout>default</layout>
	</repository>
</repositories>

  <build>
    <finalName>test-app</finalName>
  </build>
</project>

{code}

Best regards

Orazio\\
Message 1 of 2

fields.description:
Hey Bitbucket,\\
We've noticed an issue where pull requests occasionally lose the commits they're associated with a message like this:

bq. It seems that some or all of the commits that make up this pull request have been removed.


That's not true, though, and updating the pull request usually rectifies the issue. Occasionally, though, pull requests are declined by phantoms, leaving no trace as to why, just suddenly appearing in the declined list. What's the deal?
fields.summary: Pull requests are randomly automatically declined (BB-8227)

fields.description:
It is possible to create a link for the latest version of a file on a branch by replacing the commit hash with the branch name in the URL (issue BCLOUD-202).

However this doesn't work with branches containing slashes in the name, such as 'my/branch', even when URI-component-encoding the slash:

* https://bitbucket.org/yjome/test-repo/src/0f84c7de13176aa07a57aa7fdbdeebc0728d5a82/README works
* https://bitbucket.org/yjome/test-repo/src/my/branch/README 404s
* https://bitbucket.org/yjome/test-repo/src/my%2Fbranch/README 404s
fields.summary: Can't link to latest version of a file in a namespaced Git branch

fields.description:

fields.description:
It would be very nice if we could pre-fill the POST webhook URL by passing our URL in the query string:

https://bitbucket.org/Stavros/django-annoying/admin/services?post_url=http%3A//local.getinstabot.com/webhooks/bitbucket/%3Ftoken%3DFGL5RLtKf6pprUCLfuc697

And this would add a POST webhook with the URL field prefilled. This way, we could just link our users to the page, rather than tell them to copy-paste the URL.
fields.summary: Prefill POST webhook address via a URL query string (BB-8222)

With your current pricing model there is no reason for me to ever become a paying customer.

I would really appreciate some features geared towards very small outfits or even bitbucket-as-a-backup for personal projects. I would love to have a reason to hand over $5-$10 a month to help support a service that I use so heavily.

fields.description:
We are migrating our repos to Bitbucket and we found that the branches of notes are ignored, and we need to do this step manually.

I don't know how your GIT-importer works, but to get the notes we use the following configuration:

{code}
$ git remote add oldrepo git@codebasehq.com:owner/projectname/oldrepo.git
$ git config --add remote.oldrepo.fetch +refs/notes/*:refs/notes/*
$ git fetch oldrepo
remote: Counting objects: 312, done.
remote: Compressing objects: 100% (175/175), done.
remote: Total 312 (delta 103), reused 312 (delta 103)
Receiving objects: 100% (312/312), 43.88 KiB, done.
Resolving deltas: 100% (103/103), done.
From codebasehq.com:owner/projectname/oldrepo
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/bugfixes -> refs/notes/bugfixes
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/changes -> refs/notes/changes
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/features -> refs/notes/features
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/pre_deploy -> refs/notes/pre_deploy
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/versioning -> refs/notes/versioning
$ git config --add remote.bitbucket.fetch +refs/notes/*:refs/notes/*
$ git push bitbucket refs/notes/\*
Counting objects: 312, done.
Delta compression using up to 4 threads.
Compressing objects: 100% (175/175), done.
Writing objects: 100% (312/312), 43.88 KiB, done.
Total 312 (delta 103), reused 312 (delta 103)
To git@bitbucket.org:abrilmdia/alx-concursos-data-entry.git
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/bugfixes -> refs/notes/bugfixes
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/changes -> refs/notes/changes
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/features -> refs/notes/features
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/pre_deploy -> refs/notes/pre_deploy
 * [new branch]      refs/notes/versioning -> refs/notes/versioning
{code}
fields.summary: git-notes ignored when importing a repository (BB-8219)

2c08abe69c4f4d7ea4e5cd4d2aaa250a$2da5da2e006070e81acf8c1ebd23b37e

Thanks for help.
fields.summary: 500 error on repository page after failed import due to timeout (BB-8206)

fields.description:
You can display team's private repositories count on user profile page, even if you are not logged in.

User profile page https://bitbucket.org/khalas (e.g. Pywaw team - 1 repository):

!https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/101746032/private_repositories_1.png!

Team profile page https://bitbucket.org/pywaw (0 repositories):

!https://dl.dropboxusercontent.com/u/101746032/private_repositories_2.png!
fields.summary: Private repositories count

fields.description: As a reviewer it would be helpful to add additional reviews to review code especially if there is a part which needs external perspective.
fields.summary: Pull requests: As a reviewer add additional reviewers (BB-8205)

fields.description:
Would like API access to pull request resource:

Filters:

* Open
* Merged
* Declined
* Approved

Actions:

* Approve
* Decline
* Merge
fields.summary: API feature - pull request resource (BB-2021)

fields.description:
When using teams I would like my administrator group to have access to all forks of all repos owned by the team. Currently to access forks we have to log in as our team which is not ideal.

Alternative solution [#7062|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7062/use-bitbucket-as-team-feature]
fields.summary: Admin users have access to all forks

fields.description:
Ability for admins of a team to use bitbucket as team account without having to signout and sign in.

This will allow admins to have access to forks and other private data which only the team has access to by default.

Alternative solution [#7063|https://bitbucket.org/site/master/issue/7063/admin-users-have-access-to-all-forks]
fields.summary: Use bitbucket as team user feature

fields.description: sometimes, the led D1 will show red, green and white when power off

pop noise after power on

fields.description:
I would love to see hyperlinks open up a new window/tab by default in comments and issue descriptions!

It sure makes cross referencing easier when I don't have to worry about clicking back to get back to my issue.
fields.summary: Change hyperlink action in issues and comments.

fields.description:
I want to transfer my repo

https://bitbucket.org/vinay.sajip/distlib

to a team account PyPA, of which I am a member. If I go to the repository admin screen, click on "Transfer repository", enter "pypa" as the account I want to transfer to and click the button, I get an Error 500:!http://i.imgur.com/7WI2fzB.png!
fields.summary: Unable to transfer repository

fields.description: if the input verbrose file does not contain delimiter after last item. then the last item is ignored. is it necessary even for the last item on a line to end with a delimiter?

http://lord_mulder.bitbucket.org/

-> Something went wrong.

fields.description:
Tried to transfer a public repository to a Team Account, and an Error 500 occurs.

Debug messag:\\
f0547a412df74476b4415b7c2ed86308$ca7297d9f362faf53eade7473b0333f2

How to reproduce:

# go to Transfer Repository
# enter the name of a Team Account
# Click "Transfer".
fields.summary: Error 500 when transfering a repository

fields.description: I'm receiving the error "Website is currently unreachable" when attempting to create an order using the MTGoxTraceCommands.CreateOrder method.
fields.summary: Website is currently unreachable

fields.description:
Hello,

I have noticed that the size of a my repo which is displayed on the overview page is always increasing even though I have removed some big files from repo.

After deciding to dowload the code from the overview page's link instead of cloning from git I have seen that all the files that I have already removed from the repo are still included in the zip file generated from the overview page (I have made sure that those files do not exist: they are not displayed on my repo's code page and they are not downloaded when cloning from git).

This is really weird, since I want a download link so non-technical users can download the repo easily, whithout having to install and understand how GIT works.
fields.summary: Download includes files that have been removed from repository

fields.description: Right now there doesn't exist any good Language field choice for [Sphinx|http://sphinx-doc.org] source repositories. Please add "reStructuredText" to the Language list.
fields.summary: Add reStructuredText to repository language list

fields.description:
According to this https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/repository+Resource#repositoryResource-POSTanewfork I should be able to fork a repo, right?

However the sample URL to fork a repo is the same of creating a new repository.

What I need is to fork an existing repository, how can I do that?
fields.summary: Unable to create a fork via REST API, documentation problem?

fields.description:
https://bitbucket.org/mchaput/whoosh/pull-request/40/cassandra-storage-for-24x-branch/activity

i tried to comment there, tried save multiple times, but nothing happens.

if it is not allowed to comment on declined pull requests, maybe it should not offer that "what do you want to say" input field.
fields.summary: asks for comments on declined pull requests, but does not allow saving them

fields.description:
Hey guys,

Getting this error when trying to clone a repository I definitely have access rights to (and I've added my public key)

{code}
git clone git@bitbucket.org:briteweb/acu.git
Cloning into 'acu'...
ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Host is down
fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

Please make sure you have the correct access rights
and the repository exists.
{code}

Kinda struggling to work out what's wrong... help?
fields.summary: ssh: connect to host bitbucket.org port 22: Host is down fatal: Could not read from remote repository.

# I've created a repository named X
# In the instructions of this repository said about importing from SVN
# In importing from SVN, it created another repository named Y
# The svn failed because my svn server has an invalid certificate (there should be a way to accept this)
# I gave up and tried to delete the Y repository, clicking on its link
# Error 500:

Something went wrong.

You can contact support or create a public issue if the problem persists.\\
This might be useful in debugging the problem:\\
c442538c4a2a424da2f19e63115f1bd7$2da5da2e006070e81acf8c1ebd23b37e\\
You can also visit our status page.
fields.summary: Error 500 in repository

fields.description:
We really like the approval feature on Pull Requests, but we hit a situation today where I had approved something, _then_ changes were made (new commits) but my approval remained, despite me having never seen the new changes.

We think it would be great if all approvals were reset when new commits are made to a pull request, otherwise we'll simply not use the feature.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Remove approval of pull request when new commits are made after approval (BB-6784)

fields.description:
This doesn't work:

https://bitbucket.org/zyxit/qa-checkstyle-checks/src/d5b78b423889/src/main/java/com/atlassian/qa/checkstyle/checks/JavadocDetailCheck.java?at=master

But this does:

https://bitbucket.org/zyxit/qa-checkstyle-checks/src/d5b78b423889/src/main/java/com/atlassian/qa/checkstyle/CSSColour.java?at=master

The 500 page magic error code hash:

466143e6e6df4d1aacb2ac8ce302a6f5$9f657f27339e2c9334d4460f4ca76990
fields.summary: Can't browse to one particular source file - it returns 500 while others seem fine

fields.description:
I've used ReStructured text In the description of my {{frequencies}} package (in the Python Package Index), but the formatted result does not look right.  For example, underlining with equal signs does not produce a level-one heading.  Am I doing something wrong?

Phillip
fields.summary: ReStructured text is not working

fields.description:
We're using pull requests to handle code reviews. It would be great if comments had a unique identifier that could be placed into commit messages.  Then when the commit is pushed back to bitbucket, a reply is automatically generated on that comment linking back to the commit.

An alternative approach would be to allow automatic issue creation from a pull request comment.  Then the commit messages can tie directly to the issue.
fields.summary: Shorthand for generating links to PR comments in commit messages

fields.description:
One of my favourite features with Github's notifications is the ability to have separate email addresses receive different notifications depending on what organization they are being triggered from. Here's a screenshot of my current set up: http://cl.ly/image/2i010V1M1e2R

For people that are in a few different organizations, I think it's a fantastic feature.
fields.summary: Custom email routing (BB-8197)

fields.description:
Customer requested the ability to set the public/private flag on an issue tracker using a REST API.  We don't have this yet.

Probably a good idea to add similar functionality for a Wiki.
fields.summary: Set public private flag on the issue tracker itself with REST (BB-8196)

fields.description: When creating a new repository, on the "get started" page, the links are are dead -- they redirect to the same page. This is the case for the "import code" and "start from scratch"
fields.summary: get started page bug

fields.description:
I added a comment on a line of code in a pull-request. A notification was sent by email, but the comment is not shown when I reload the page.

I tried many times on many repos and always got the same problem.
fields.summary: Can't comment on or approve pull requests (500 error)

fields.description: Previously I had received emails for any new, changed, resolved issues and now all of a sudden they have stopped. I haven't changed any administrative settings or email accounts.
fields.summary: No longer receiving emails from IssueTracker

fields.description:
I have two local branches: "develop" and "master".

On my local develop branch I created a new project and kept pushing commits to the remote develop branch.

Issues during development where added and resolved via commit messages.

However I've just released the project and merged my local develop branch into my local master branch. So far so good, but after pushing the changes to remote all the issues that where resolved via commits in my develop branch just got another comment with exactly the same commit message.

To prevent clutter I've deleted all the duplicated comments by hand since there where only a dozen so far but imagine the chaos if there were hundreds.

Can this be fixed or should I change something in my workflow?
fields.summary: Issue actions in commit messages from one branch shouldn't repeat when merging that branch (BB-8204)

fields.description:
After a release of AUI that usually pushes two commits to our repo there's only one commit. I can see the two commits locally on buildbox though which suggests something happened during the push (You can see the commit here https://bitbucket.org/atlassian/aui/commits/all) .

I can't seem to pull this commit to my local clone either, git pull origin master only pulls up to the commit before  (I also attempted to merge in a PR before I realised something was funny, that also failed.).  A fresh clone also doesn't pull in this commit.

Is anyone able to check the state of our repo?  I'm not sure how to proceed.  Not being able to merge in PR's will definitely be a blocker for us.

Thanks!
fields.summary: AUI Repo is behaving strangely

fields.description:
You can see the list of approved users at https://bitbucket.org/magick/app.ui/admin/access\\
And you can see the commits at https://bitbucket.org/magick/app.ui/commits/all

Latest commit is from someone unknows.
fields.summary: someone committed code to my repo - not a member of approved/invited team

fields.description:
broken link

https://bitbucket.org/account/password/reset/confirm/[redacted]

username: [redacted]

[email redacted]
fields.summary: Broken link for password reset

fields.description:
I have two repos that use mercurial's patch queues. Pushing to them via ssh has been working fine for ages, but stopped working on or after 27 March. Now I can't push the main repo via ssh, but can push the related .hg/patches repo.

Pushing via ssh gives the error

abort: no suitable response from remote hg!

I use the hgrc file for the url to push to, and this hasn't changed, so I know I am pushing to the right place.

Non-mq mercurial repositories are working fine via ssh.

Pushing via https DOES work, but is a big pain.

Both repos are team-owned, in case that is relevant.
fields.summary: push to repo using mq broken via ssh

fields.description:
On https://bitbucket.org/plans I expected clicking choose would go to https://bitbucket.org/account/create-team/ .

Instead, it went right to the Atlassian billing page and converted my individual account into a team account without confirming this is what I wanted  to do.

Now I have to go through this process, which I should not have to do: https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/BITBUCKET/Renaming%2C+Converting%2C+or+Deleting+an+Account#Renaming,Converting,orDeletinganAccount-ConvertingaTeamAccounttoanIndividualAccount
fields.summary: Accidental Team Creation
